title: Oven Temp: Table, Inst. Rate of Change

The temperature, in degrees Celsius ( C), of an oven being heated is modeled by an increasing differentiable function H of time t, where t is measured in minutes. The table above gives the temperature as recorded every 4 minutes over a 16-minute period.
content.question: Use the data in the table to estimate the instantaneous rate at which the temperature of the oven is changing at time t = 10. Show the computations that lead to your answer. Indicate units of measure.

frqParts.text: Use the data in the table to estimate the instantaneous rate at which the temperature of the oven is changing at time t = 10. Show the computations that lead to your answer. Indicate units of measure.

topic.text: 2.1: Defining Average and Instantaneous Rates of Change at a Point

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
